tit.e: Tetsudai Fushin (Large-scale engineering work by federal lords under shogun's order)
tit.cmt: 原文で、てつだいふしんと読み仮名がふられているので、以下それに合わせました。
tit.e: Tetsudai Fushin (Large-scale engineering work by federal lords under shogun's order)
Tetsudai Fushin (Large-scale engineering work by federal lords under shogun's order)

sen.j: 手伝普請（てつだいふしん）は、豊臣政権や江戸幕府が諸大名に命じて行わせた大規模な土木建築工事のことである。
sen.e: Tetsudai Fushin was a large-scale civil engineering work done by territorial lords under the orders from the Toyotomi government and the Edo Shogunate.
Tetsudai Fushin was a large-scale civil engineering work done by territorial lords under the orders from the Toyotomi government and the Edo Shogunate.

sen.j: 近世の統一政権の成立が前提となる。
sen.e: It is based on the establishment of a unified authority in the early-modern times.
It is based on the establishment of a unified authority in the early-modern times.

sen.j: 大坂城、聚楽第、方広寺大仏殿、肥前国の名護屋城、伏見城などが築城・造営された。
sen.e: Buildings such as Osaka-jo Castle, Jurakudai Residence, Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall, Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province, and Fushimi-jo Castle were built and constructed.
Buildings such as Osaka-jo Castle, Jurakudai Residence, Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall, Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province, and Fushimi-jo Castle were constructed.

sen.e: Buildings such as Osaka-jo Castle, Jurakudai Residence, Hoko-ji Temple Daibutsu-den Hall, Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province, and Fushimi-jo Castle were constructed.

sen.j: 諸大名の主たる負担は人足の提供であり、資材を供出することもあった。
sen.e: Territorial lords mainly provided laborors and sometimes supplied building materials.

sen.j: 実際に現場に出た人足たちには扶持米を支給しなければならなかった。
sen.e: They had to provide salary rice to the laborers who actually worked at the construction sites.

sen.j: また、賦課基準となったのは石高である。
sen.e: Also, the standard of imposition was Kokudaka (a system for determining land value for tribute purposes in the Edo period).

sen.j: 文禄・慶長の役の軍事的な負担とともに、諸大名の財政を逼迫させることになった。
sen.e: It strained the financial status of the territorial lords along with the military responsibilities in the Bunroku-Keicho War.

sen.j: 江戸城下町建設のために、千石夫（役高1000石につき1人の人足）を徴発したことに始まる。
sen.e: It started with the requisition of Sengokufu (one laboer per yakudaka (salary paid in accordance with the rank of one's post)1000) for the construction of the castle town of Edo-jo Castle.

sen.cmt: 全角カッコを修正しました。1000石が抜けていたので追加しました。

sen.j: その後、江戸城、彦根城、篠山城、亀山城 (丹波国)、駿府城、名古屋城、高田城などの築城が続き、大名が普請に動員された。
sen.e: After that, Edo-jo Castle, Hikone-jo Castle, Kameyama-jo Castle (Tanba Province), Sunpu-jo Castle, and Nagoya-jo Castle, and Takada-jo Castle were constructed, and the territorial lords were mobilized for Fushin.

After that, Edo-jo Castle, Hikone-jo Castle, Kameyama-jo Castle (Tanba Province), Sunpu-jo Castle, Nagoya-jo Castle, and Takada-jo Castle were constructed, and the territorial lords were mobilized for Fushin.

sen.e: After that, Edo-jo Castle, Hikone-jo Castle, Kameyama-jo Castle (Tanba Province), Sunpu-jo Castle, Nagoya-jo Castle, and Takada-jo Castle were constructed, and the territorial lords were mobilized for Fushin.

sen.j: 江戸時代初期の諸大名は、幕府の普請動員に応えるために、自らの領内の支配体制を整える必要があった。
sen.e: The territorial lords in the early Edo period needed to adjust the ruling system in their own territory in order to respond to the order from the Shogunate to mobilize for Fushin.

sen.j: 将軍が諸大名に対して強大な権力を誇示したように、藩内においては藩主自らを頂点とした体制を固めさせられることになったのである（「藩体制の成立」と呼ばれる）。
sen.e: Just as the Shogun had enourmous authority over the territorial lords, the lords of the domains were required to establish the system with themselves ruling at the top (called "the establishment of the Domain System").

Just as the Shogun had enourmous authority over the territorial lords, the lords of the domains were required to establish the system with themselves ruling at the top (called "the establishment of the Domain System").

sen.j: 家老・一族と藩主との権力闘争は軋轢を生み、多くの御家騒動を引き起こした。
sen.e: The strife over authority between the Karo (chief retainer)'s family and the lord of the domain led to conflicts and caused many family troubles.
The strife over authority between the Karo (chief retainer) or the lord's own family and the lord of the domain led to conflicts and caused many family troubles.
sen.cmt: 「家老・一族」は家老と藩主の一族と理解しました。
sen.e: The strife over authority between the Karo (chief retainer) or the lord's own family and the lord of the domain led to conflicts and caused many family troubles.

sen.j: また、外様大名は手伝普請に動員されることを通じて、幕府の軍役体系に組み込まれていった。
sen.e: Also, Tozama Daimyo (nonhereditary feudal lords) were integrated into the military system of the Shogunate by the mobilization for Tetsudai Fushin.

sen.j: 江戸時代中期になると、河川の普請が多く行われるようになった。
sen.e: In the middle Edo period, many Fushin of rivers were conducted.
In the middle Edo period, many Fushin of rivers were conducted.
In the middle Edo period, many Fushin of rivers were conducted.

sen.j: 宝永の大和川改修工事、寛保の関東水損地域の河川・堤防改修工事、薩摩藩による宝暦期の木曾川・長良川・揖斐川の治水工事（宝暦治水事件）などが有名である。
sen.e: Among the most famous Fushin of rivers were the repair work of Yamato-gawa River in the Hoei era, the repair works of rivers and embankments in the flood-damaged areas in the Kanto reigion in the Kanpo era, and the embankment works of Kiso-gawa River, Nagara-gawa River, and Ibi-gawa River by Satsuma Domain in the Houreki era.

Among the most famous Fushin of rivers were the repair work of Yamato-gawa River in the Hoei era, the repair works of rivers and embankments in the flood-damaged areas in the Kanto region in the Kanpo era, and the embankment works of Kiso-gawa River, Nagara-gawa River, and Ibi-gawa River by Satsuma Domain in the Houreki era (Horeki Chisui Incident).
sen.cmt: reigionをregionに訂正しました。（宝暦治水事件）の訳が抜けていたのでHoreki Chisui Incidentとしました。

sen.j: 築城・治水の他に手伝普請の対象となったのは、日光の社寺、徳川家の菩提寺である寛永寺・増上寺、将軍および家族の霊廟、禁裏・御所などの造営・修復である。
sen.e: Apart from constructions of castles and embankment works, the following were the fruits of Testudai Fushin: the constructions and repair works of shrines and temples in Nikko, Tokugawa Family's family temples, namely Kanei-ji Temple and Zojo-ji Temple, the mausoleums of the Shogun and his family, the Imperial Palace and Residence.

Apart from constructions of castles and embankment works, the constructions and repair works of the following buildings were done by Tetsudai Fushin: shrines and temples in Nikko, Tokugawa Family's temples, namely Kanei-ji Temple and Zojo-ji Temple, the mausoleums of the Shogun and his family, the Imperial Palace and Residence.

sen.j: 江戸時代の初期には、各藩が費用を負担し、実際に藩が取り仕切って普請が行われていた。
sen.e: In the early Edo period, each domain paid the expenses and the domain was actually in charge of Fushin.
In the early Edo period, each domain paid the expenses and the domain was actually in charge of Fushin.

sen.j: しかし、時代が下るにしたがって、落札した町人などが現場の責任を負う請負形式が多くなり、さらには金納化も進行した。
sen.e: However, as time went by, Fushin was increasingly conducted by contracts made by merchants, and payment in gold became more and more common.
However, as time went by, Fushin was increasingly conducted by contracts made by merchants, and payment in cash became more and more common.
sen.cmt: 金納は文字通りの金goldではなく金銭の意です。

sen.j: そして、安永4年（1775年）以降は完全に金納化が通常の形となった。
sen.e: And after 1775, payment in gold became the regular form of payment.
And after 1775, payment in cash became the regular form of payment.

sen.j: 基本的には、各藩は費用を負担するだけとなり、幕府が直接担当役人を派遣して指揮監督するようになった。
sen.e: Basically, each domain was responsible only for the expenses, and the Shogunate sent officials to supervise Fushin.

sen.j: 江戸時代の手伝普請も各藩の負担は過重であり、藩の財政を逼迫させる要因のひとつとなった。
sen.e: Tetsudai Fushin in the Edo period strained the financial status of each domain and became one of the causes for the financial difficulties of the domains.

sen.j: ただし、他の課役・重職を担っている藩には、手伝普請を軽減あるいは免除する処置がとられた。
sen.e: However, Tetsudai Fushinthe was reduced or exempted from the domains which were assigned other tasks.

sen.j: 中後期の例では、尾張藩・紀州藩・水戸藩・加賀藩、老中などの要職在任中の藩、伺候席の大名、長崎警固を担う佐賀藩・福岡藩は免除されていた。
sen.e: For example, in the middle and later period, Tetsudai Fushin was exempted from Owari Domain, Kishu Domain, Mito Domain, Kaga Domain, the domains with their lords filling such important posts as Roju, the feudal lords of Shikoseki, Saga Domain and Fukuoka Domain, which were in charge of the guard of Nagasaki.
sen.cmt: 伺候席の大名、はどこに掛かっているのかやや不明です。
sen.e: For example, following domains were exempted from Tetsudai Fushin in the middle and later period: Owari, Kishu, Mito, and Kaga; the domains with their lords filling such important posts as Roju; the domains with their lords filling the posts of shikoseki (anteroom seats for feudal lords and direct retainer of the shogun at the Edo-jo castle); and the domains in charge of the guard of Nagasaki, namely Saga and Fukuoka.
